messages.body: $OLED  Japan Display shares plunge over 20 percent on Apple OLED report https://reut.rs/2LES6Jh   $AAPL $QQQ

links.title: Japan Display shares plunge over 20 percent on Apple OLED report
links.description: TOKYO/SEOUL (Reuters) - Japan Display shares plummeted more than 20 percent after South Korea's Electronic Times reported that Apple Inc had decided to use OLED screens for all new iPhone models for next year. Apple recently started planning new iPhone models and decided all three models would have OLED (organic light-emitting diode) panels, the report said on Monday, citing multiple unnamed industry sources.

links.title: Display Makers Dip on Report Apple OLED Shift in 2019
links.description: The shares of Japan Display Inc., Sharp Corp. and other display suppliers for Apple Inc. fell after South Korea's Electronic Times reported that the iPhone maker has decided to use next-generation screens for all of its new models next year.

links.title: Latest iPhone X Flaw Highlights Apple's Massive Problem
links.description: This last week has seen a rising number of reports of the back camera lens cracking on the iPhone X. Once again quality control and the high cost of a 'repair' is threatening Apple's reputation as a safe and trusted smartphone manufacturer.

links.title: Is the Stock Market a Ponzi Scheme?
links.description: An acquaintance of mine directed me to a video in which Tan Liu talked about his view of the stock market being a Ponzi scheme. For your convenience, I quickly grabbed the definition of a Ponzi scheme from Investopedia: "A Ponzi scheme is a fraudulent investing scam promising high rates of return with little risk to investors.

links.title: Saber Capital 4Q17 Letter: 2017 Review, Apple, and Tencent - InvestorAlmanac
links.description: Saber Capital Management Letter to Investors: 2017 Review, February 15, 2018 In 2017, portfolio gained 30.7% gross (25.3% net) vs. S&P 500 gain of 21.8% 3 biggest drivers were Apple, Verisign, and Tencent; gained 46%, 50%, and 114% respectively in 2017 Selling Too Early It was a mistake to sell our bank basket (JPM and BAC).
